tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE customers_preferences (
  customer_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  first_name VARCHAR(255),
  last_name VARCHAR(255),
  email VARCHAR(255),
  preference_1 BOOLEAN,
  preference_2 BOOLEAN,
  preference_3 BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE customer_preferences (
  customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(255),
  email VARCHAR(255),
  preference_1 BOOLEAN,
  preference_2 BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE email_content (
  email_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  recipient_id INT,
  subject VARCHAR(255),
  body TEXT,
  sent_date TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (recipient_id) REFERENCES customer_preferences(customer_id)
)

CREATE TABLE customers (
    customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_name VARCHAR(100),
    email_address VARCHAR(255),
    preferences JSONB
)

CREATE TABLE email_templates (
    template_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    template_name VARCHAR(100),
    subject_line VARCHAR(255),
    content TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE email_campaigns (
    campaign_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    campaign_name VARCHAR(100),
    start_date DATE,
    end_date DATE,
    template_id INT REFERENCES email_templates(template_id)
)

CREATE TABLE campaign_recipients (
    recipient_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    campaign_id INT REFERENCES email_campaigns(campaign_id),
    customer_id INT REFERENCES customers(customer_id),
    sent_date TIMESTAMP,
    opened BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE customers (
    customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_name VARCHAR(50),
    customer_email VARCHAR(100),
    preference_1 VARCHAR(50),
    preference_2 VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE email_templates (
    template_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    template_name VARCHAR(50),
    template_content TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE preferences (
    preference_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    preference_name VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE customer_preferences (
    customer_id INT,
    preference_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(customer_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (preference_id) REFERENCES preferences(preference_id)
)

CREATE TABLE dynamic_email_content (
    email_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT,
    template_id INT,
    dynamic_content TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(customer_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (template_id) REFERENCES email_templates(template_id)
)
